radiographic_examinations.findings: Aneurysm of the ascending aorta measuring up to 6 cm in diameter with a focal outpouching posteriorly; high-attenuation pericardial effusion; apparent filling defects in the right and left main pulmonary arteries; complete occlusion of blood flow into the right main pulmonary artery.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Intraoperative echocardiography demonstrated a focal dissection of the mid ascending aorta and no flow in the right main pulmonary artery; postoperative computed tomographic angiography demonstrated unobstructed main, right, and left pulmonary arteries with normal flow.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Focal dissection of the mid ascending aorta with a posterior wall hematoma.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No flow seen in the right main pulmonary artery; minimal flow detected in the left main pulmonary artery; after graft replacement of the ascending aorta, unobstructed main, right, and left pulmonary arteries were demonstrated.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Contrast opacified main, right, and left pulmonary arteries without filling defect.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Contrast opacified arteries were seen after ascending aortic replacement, indicating improvement.
